page.title: 03Earlswood Village
page.content: Earlswood Village has its own village hall, where local clubs and societies meet, three public houses and a very active Methodist Church. The Earlswood Lakes have provided the area with many leisure activities since they were created in the early nineteenth century.In the 1880's, with the advent of the bicycle, people used to cycle miles to spend "a day out" at Earlswood, known then as the{ {Scarborough of the Midlands}There were seven Tea gardens in the village and an Edwardian Dance Hall at the Red Lion public house. The early twentieth century brought the Warwickshire Railway line giving people the opportunity to travel further.Housing, an increase in population and the motor car brought changes in the area.Today the building of the{M42}will no doubt bring more.
